page.title: 12INGLEBY ARNCLIFFE VILLAGE
page.content: Ingleby Arncliffe (pop 350) is cut off from neighbouring villages by its position between two busy roads, A19 & A172. The parish church also lies away from the village across A172, where it stands next to Arncliffe Hall. The village is divided into two sections. Ingleby Cross is a group of buildings situated around the crossroads of the former Stokesley to Northallerton road A pub,the Village Hall and war memorial are here. Ingleby Arncliffe lies 800 m. up the hill. The two are linked together now by new housing. In recent years housing deveopments have produced a commuter village serving Teesside via A19. The one shop and post office are situated in the main street. Also here, are the Methodist Chapel built in 1863, and the village school. The local butcher owns the abattoir which lies behind the Main St
